author: Michael McNulty
title: Grow Our Own Teams
description: Untapped expertise already exists in Catalyst. Recruited teams might not share Cardano's vision and values.

assessments.note: while this proposal identifies a great opportunity, it fails to identify a problem which fits within the challenge of scaling up DeFi within the Cardano ecosystem. There is a great pool of talent available, but it isn't clear how this proposal would boost DeFi. The proposal is aimed at generating teams which may or may not produce rather than delivering results which are directly tied to DeFi.

While the vision is to grow organic collaboration within the development ecosystem, the proposer does not provide specific details as to how this would be achieved.  A more detailed proposal with a clear structure would be required to avoid being redundant with Catalyst itself.
I like the idea of having a more proactive method of on ramping developers and forming teams.

The focus of the proposal is not DeFi, but on onboarding and discussing mechanisms for team building. KPIS described are not KPIs but metrics, these metrics are not related to the metrics established in the challenge brief, which indicates a lack of alignment with the challenge. Although I do not see the alignment of this proposal with this challenge, I think it can be included in an appropriate challenge, such as the Value Onboarding Challenge.
Does not directly address the challenge. Might better fit in distributed decision making fund.
The proposal doesn't have relation with DeFi.
While the proposal would likely be successful in connecting people in various ways, it isn't clear how this would boost DeFi.
Would have liked a little more relevant experience information, and more details on how the solutions will be staged.

feasibility:  1/5
It is hard to judge the feasibility of the proposal because no specific achievements or goals are specified. The proposer did not participate in discussion during the refinement phase so I doubt their commitment to the project.

The proposer has relevant experiences for the described proposal, is a participative member of Catalyst and one of the facilitators / organizers of the Catalyst Retros.

There is no structured plan, the proposal needs to be better detailed. There is no budget breakdown. I recommend including this information so that it is possible to judge the feasibility of the plan and the proposal.
No plan on how to actually achieve the stated goals. What formats are you going to use (voice [clubhouse?]chat, video, text, etc?). How are you going to pull people together?

No experience given about creating communities.
Unclear how the plan improves the current tools in place.
The proposal doesn't identify how generation of teams will create more DeFi users within the cardano ecosystem.
Would have liked more details in the plan portion, on how the solution will be approached.

auditability: 1/5
The proposer does not detail the allocation of funds or propose auditable goals.

The metrics described are good indicators for this proposal, they would allow a successful understanding of the proposal, however the absence of KPIs (The items called KPIs are not KPIs, as they do not establish indicators or tangible numbers) makes it difficult to measure impact and compromises auditability.

There are no roadmap and budget breakdown, wich makes auditability difficult.

There is relevant information about the proposer's experience.

No clear plan on how to achieve goal, thus not possible to audit progress. This proposal is more a statement of something that needs to be done that a proposal on how to do it. No clear budget for the use of funds.
Indicators are mentioned, but no objective or key result.

solution: Connect our own experts to grow native DeFi teams that are already bought in on the Catalyst mission.
experience:
Engaged community member, retro organizer / facilitator

Catalyst SWARM
